answers.answer: Welcome to the gastroenteology community!  How were you diagnosed with this?  How long has this been going on for?
Probably for about 3 years. It was discovered during a recent colonoscopy.
Have you been checked for crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis?
No I have not.  I don't have diarhrea or bleeding along with the mild pain, whichare usually part of those two conditions. Maybe in the early stages you don'thave all the symptoms.
You are correct, IBD is still a possibility.  This should have been checked for during the colonoscopy.
I have a follow-up appointment with the GI doctor next month and I will beasking a bunch of questions about this.

question: I have ulceration of my ileum. I get discomfort and mild pain in my lower ab region. No other symptoms. I take BP meds and Metformin for diabetes. Occasionally Tramadol for back pain.What causes this and how do I treat it?Negative for H Pryori. Colon also ok.
title: Ulceration of Ileum
